conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Point A is at the top left, point B is at the top center, and point C is at the top right. Containers D and E are at the bottom.
Horizontal bars act as baffles, and vertical baffles are present further down.
Liquid from A flows downward initially.
Liquid from B flows downward initially.
Liquid from C flows downward initially.
Liquid from A hits the first horizontal baffle and starts flowing horizontally to the right.
Liquid from B hits the first horizontal baffle and starts flowing horizontally to the right.
Liquid from C flows directly downward without hitting the first horizontal baffle immediately.
Liquid from A continues its horizontal flow until it hits the next vertical baffle, changing direction and flowing downward.
Liquid from B continues its horizontal flow until it hits the next vertical baffle, changing direction and flowing downward.
Liquid from C continues flowing straight down and hits a baffle, changing its direction slightly but continuing downward.
Liquid from A flows into container E after changing direction.
Liquid from B flows into container E after changing direction.
Liquid from C flows into container E after continuing downward.
All liquids from points A, B, and C flow into container E.
